summary a 35 year old man comes to the outpatient department with complaint of having been trying to conceive with his partner for over  i e g smoking history of past testicular injury and smoking on assessment no obvious physical symptoms but he reports reduced libido and occasional erection dysfunction management administer saline if necessary administer analgesics administer intravenous fluids and administer antipyretics to reduce urinalysis administer steroids to control the bleeding and prevent further bleeding administer antibiotics for ovulation
